newsitem.title: UK: Devil imagery in soft drink ad too scary for kids.
newsitem.headline: Devil imagery in soft drink ad too scary for kids.

text.p: A soft drink advertisement showing a boy with horns and glowing eyes has been restricted to late night television after viewers complained it was too disturbing for children, the industry watchdog said on Wednesday.

Britain's Independent Television Commission (ITC), which licenses and regulates Britain's commercial TV, said it had restricted the television advert for the fizzy drink Irn Bru, after it received 57 complaints.
The ITC's move underscores growing public concern about the use of demonic images in advertising.

A controversial campaign by the ruling Conservative Party -- featuring opposition Labour Party leader Tony Blair with red, satanic eyes -- is being investigated by the Advertising Standards Authority, which regulates press and poster ads.
The Irn Bru soft drink advert was originally banned from children's programmes by the Broadcast Advertising Clearance Centre (BACC), the body which vets advertising for the ITC.
But it was aired before the broadcasting "watershed" time of 9.00 pm because of a technical error, the ITC said.
